poem:
"Power Brokers in the East"

In the fortress of Beijing, resounding ties bind,
Brothers-in-arms on an ancient battleground inked.
Putin and Xi, East's potentates combined,
Deep waters of diplomacy in Sino-Russian linked.
Strong as iron, their bond is laced,
Silent whispers of power tracked and traced.
From Kremlin to Great Wall, a pact embraced,
In the chess of nations, pieces intricately placed.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Putin and Xi announce plans to strengthen military ties in Beijing Russia and China have announced they will deepen their already close military ties, as Vladimir Putin met Xi Jinping in Beijing on his first foreign trip since being inaugurated for a new term as Russia’s president. It is the latest in a string of statements and signals that the warm relationship between the two countries is as strong as it has ever been. Xi’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
